comments:
Build N20040331

I have a workspace (containing org.eclipse.jdt.core project and its 
corresponding test suite projects). When I switched today to last night's 
nightly build, I get the following errors in the console whenever I launch my 
JUnit Plug-in Test configuration:
org.osgi.framework.BundleException: A bundle with the unique ID and version is 
already installed: org.eclipse.core.runtime 3.0.0
This is something new; I've never had this proble in M8.

0ms for 200 roots

Wassim, this sounds very similar to the problem we discussed yesterday, and 
could be caused by platform.xml being removed after it gets generated.
I will try to reproduce it on my machine and report back my findings.

This is caused by bug 51165.
The already installed bundles (*.osgi.* , core.runtime, update.configurator) 
have a file url of the form file:d:/eclipse..... which is not consistent with 
the url form returned by java.io.File.toURL(), so bundle url comparison fails, 
and we try to install the same bundle again, but with a slightly different url.

This should be no harm now, but if you notice anything wrong please add it to 
this bug.

A bundle with the unique ID and version is  already installed: org.eclipse.update.configurator 3.0.0
